Een universitaire opleiding afgerond. Denk hierbij aan opleiding als Econometrie, Informatica, Quantitative Finance, Machine Learning, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Wiskunde, Statistiek of een verwante kwantitatieve opleiding; Ten minste 2 jaar werkervaring met (voorspellende) analysemethoden, machine learning technieken en of modelling; Ervaring met één of meerdere programmeertalen, bijvoorbeeld: SQL, Python, R of Scala, PySpark; Kennis van visualisatie tools, bijvoorbeeld Tableau of Microsoft PowerBI; Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel mondeling als in geschrifte.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: As a Senior Data Scientist you analyse, enrich and build machine learning solutions on top of the richest data sources of the bank. Together, the people in our data science area create solutions that are of value to our customers and help to fight financial and economic crime.You and your jobYour experience of building data science solutions and working with billions and billions of records of data will be your main guide during your day-to-day job while you provide valuable insights for more than 7 million customers. As a Senior Data Scientist you will work with a state-of-the-art data science toolkit and collaborate closely with a team of experienced data scientists and data engineers in an agile environment. You and your team are working on categorization of transactions. By doing so for all payments in the Rabobank app, you provide spending insights for millions of customers.Facts & FiguresYou work with :150 other data scientists, data engineers and ML Ops engineers from various backgrounds and 15+ nationalitiesMonthly learning sessions to share ideas and exchange knowledge with data scientists, engineers and product managersThe department has end-to-end responsibility of 10+ ML solutionsTop 3 ResponsibilitiesBring value to the business by designing, developing and deploying models in a responsible way to ensure a smooth validation process and tangible business impact;Make impact with new data science use cases by practicing your communication skills and effectively sharing your observations with stakeholders;Prove the added value of MLOps by identifying flaws at the earliest possible moment and implement the best MLOps practices accordingly. After all, you and your team are end-to-end responsible for the ML solutions you develop together!Together we achieve more than aloneCollaboration is at the heart of everything we do. The team brings diverse and talented people together to perform the best they can.As a Data Scientist, I absolutely enjoy working on the challenging business problems that are presented to us. You go from diving into exploratory analyses to developing full products - together with hugely motivated and ambitious colleagues. There is a lot of room for your development, own initiatives and there are many opportunities to contribute to the area and make a difference for Rabobank! Wouter Smit, Data ScientistYou will be part of a very dynamic and international team including highly motivated team members.Working together is the way we work as we are one results-driven, data-minded and analytical team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a better world together, a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.You and your talentMaster or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Data science, Computer Science or related field>5 years of relevant working experience in data science, with a strong statistical componentExperience with leading development of data science productsExperience with production models and clear understanding of MLOps is a mustExperience with Python, Git, PySpark and DatabricksExperience with Azure DevOps and software engineering is a plusWants to get better every dayHands-on mentalityStrong communication skillsBe the driver, take initiative and be proactiveThis Is What We Offer You€ 4.848,64 to € 6.926,62 gross per month based on 36-hour work week (scale 10) and depending on experienceAn extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid outThirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowanceHybrid working: we work 1 or 2 days a week from the officeThis is a selection of the terms of employment based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.You and the job application processApply to this vacancyAny questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Lisa Boschma, recruiter via lisa.boschma@rabobank.nl We will conduct the interviews through a video call.You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on Frequently asked questions - Careers at RabobankA security check is part of the process.We respect your privacy.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: At a glanceABN is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to improve our customers experience providing a more personalized touch in their day-to-day banking.Your jobThe candidate is expected to fulfil the following responsibilities fully independent and with great ownership. Design the analysis: explicitly plan the analysis, anticipate and address competing explanation, determine the best way to evaluate the intended results. Conduct analysis: wrangle and explore the data appropriately, visualize and present the exploration results; develop/apply and devise appropriate algorithms; work as a thought data and algorithms lead; identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged through the product capabilities; work closely with the data engineering team to strategize and execute the development of data products; help solve various problems and make a true impact across various business units and domains. Business implementation: Discover the needs of the business/user; package technical work for diverse audiences; navigate the business organization structure; build a business network ; communicate analytic solutions to stakeholders and implement improvements as needed to operational systems. Engineering integration: Develop data pipelines from and to different (cloud and no-cloud) locations; make work compatible with the operationalisation stack; apply hands-on knowledge of the MLOps practices; co-create solution architectures; bring analytical models into production by collaborating with the engineers, co-create solution architectures. Way of working (WoW): Shape and enforce the WoW of the team and align it with other teams; work independently; collaborate with others; continuous improvement mindset; Lead complex use case: Lead complex projects, particularly XFN (cross-functional) projects; helping and influencing the grids (tribes) in the business line and the business units to prioritize their roadmap for more data driven solutions. Build the profession: Present in internal meetings and knowledge sharing sessions, as well as external conferences, meetups, workshops, encourage the team and staff; able to mentor and lead other data scientists.Working environmentThe CoE is a comprehensive data & analytics team part of Customer and Digital Experience (CDE) in ABN AMRO. Within Customer & Digital Experience the online platforms are being created and built that offer all the digital products of ABN AMRO. All these developments and products are powered by the data & analytics of our CoE.We strongly believe that online banking should be easier, faster, more delightful, and more personal to create sustainable long-term relationships with our customers. To do so, we develop suitable solutions that give our customers greater financial control. With a vast amount of data at hand, together with our unique usability lab as test-station we build digital services in an agile way that surprise customers and help them move forward. At Customer & Digital Experience you get the freedom and responsibility to improve our products & services. In other words, we encourage you to release your creativity and put it into practice. The environment is similar to a start-up atmosphere - feel free to wear your sneakers.Your profileThe ideal candidate is expected to: Have a master’s degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, statistics; econometrics or related field; 5+ years of relevant industry experience Be able to analyse problems and strategize for better solutions Be comfortable in both a leadership and team-player role Be a creative problem solver who thrives when presented with a challenge Be goal-oriented, organized team player Good interpersonal skills and communication Expert in a wide arsenal of statistical, machine learning, deep learning and operation research techniques to help solve different classes of problems; having a deep knowledge of the models, their pitfall, knowing what types of transformations work best with them, being able to recommend, coach and convince other data scientists on the right technical approach, being able to balance between the model quality and the speed of delivery; Experience in network science and customer journey analysis; Comfort working in a dynamic environment with several ongoing concurrent projects; able to prioritize, and manage time effectively Experience with coaching and mentoring junior data scientists Up-to-date on the latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potentials clearly and confidently Proficiency in using SQL, Python and PySpark. Knowledge of at least one of the cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) Experience in Banking and/or e-Commerce is a plus.We are offeringWe offer you a challenging position in a professional environment in which you get the opportunity to be the best version of yourself. You will be able to gain a lot of knowledge of the financial field and further develop your data science skills. We also offer the possibility to follow general and (specific) data science trainings. We offer you excellent terms of employment and benefits: A good monthly salary based on a 40-hour working week A position that offers a lot of opportunities for professional development The ability to work flexibly We help you to stay fit & vital An additional benefit budget of 11%, with which you can buy flexible terms of employment A personal development budget of € 1,000 per year An annual public transport ticket for unlimited travel A good pension scheme A great organization with a great work culture Interesting work and challenging projects A team that likes to help, supplement and strengthen each otherInterested?Are you interested? Please respond to this vacancy now. For more information about the role, please contact Valerio Ciotti, Team Lead Data Science (valerio.ciotti@nl.abnamro.com). For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Nicay Hertogs (nicay.hertogs@nl.abnamro.com).The interview processFirst interview (1 hour): we will get to know each other during the first interview. Aim of the interview is to assess the level of seniority and the fit with the team. We will also spend some time explaining what we are working on.Second interview (1 hour): There is a take home assignment. This is a modelling/data analysis, machine learning assignment designed to take a couple of hours to complete. Based on the outcome of the use case, we will invite you to present your results and test your technical knowledge on ML and statistics.Third interview (45 min): Cultural fit and your interest in working in ABN.Equal opportunities for allThe success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.Disclaimer external recruitment agenciesExternal recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.Wij vragen Goede communicatie vaardigheden Wij bieden Analytische skills

title: Data Consultant
description: Het analyseren en structureren van databronnen door de inzet van nieuwe technologie; Analyses op diverse databronnen die tot nieuwe inzichten en patronen leiden; Het bedenken en uitvoeren van technische oplossingen voor verschillende onderdelen van de organisatie (procesoptimalisatie en of automatisering). Je bent betrokken bij het bouwen en valideren van (voorspellende) modellen; Het actief meedenken bij de vertaling van data vraagstukken naar technische oplossingen; Het eventueel coachen en opleiden van Junior Data Consultants. Een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 3.500 tot maximaal € 4.500; Een uitdagend tailor made leerpad; 1-op-1-begeleiding en career counseling door een fieldmanager; Toegang tot de Bright Academy en een online leeromgeving; Een laptop en telefoon; 22,5 vakantiedagen op basis van 36 uur; Een contract van een jaar met als doel bij goed functioneren een contract voor onbepaalde tijd; Doorgroeimogelijkheden naar bijvoorbeeld posities als Senior data Scientist, Data Modeller, of Data engineer of eventueel zelfs een leidinggevende positie. Een universitaire opleiding afgerond. Denk hierbij aan opleiding als Econometrie, Informatica, Quantitative Finance, Machine Learning, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Wiskunde, Statistiek of een verwante kwantitatieve opleiding; Ten minste 2 jaar werkervaring met (voorspellende) analysemethoden, machine learning technieken en of modelling; Ervaring met één of meerdere programmeertalen, bijvoorbeeld: SQL, Python, R of Scala, PySpark; Kennis van visualisatie tools, bijvoorbeeld Tableau of Microsoft PowerBi; Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel mondeling als in geschrifte.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: Wat ga je doenAls Senior Data Engineer bij Future Facts leg jij het fundament voor onze Data Scientists en zorg je ervoor dat onze klanten waarde blijven halen uit hun modellen. Dit doe je door het ontwikkelen en implementeren van Machine Learning- en AI-oplossingen en het programmeren van datasystemen.Samen met een hecht en ambitieus team van meer dan 36 collega's ben je projectmatig bezig bij nieuwe en bestaande klanten verspreid over Nederland. Wij zijn niet gespecialiseerd in één sector, maar zoeken juist de uitdaging op door vele verschillende sectoren te helpen. Maar wel met één gemeenschappelijke factor: bij alle bedrijven maak je direct maatschappelijke impact.Elk project is anders en heeft daarom een ​​andere benadering nodig. Samen met je team bepaal je dan ook de meest efficiënte aanpak en de juiste tooling voor elk project. Jouw expertise en aanpak maken jou de beste adviseur voor het implementeren van onze oplossingen. De data- en machine learning engineers binnen Future Facts zijn de motor en brandstof achter onze oplossingen. In de praktijk betekent dit dat je veel bezig bent met het afstemmen van benodigdheden met technische en minder technische teamgenoten, het programmeren van verschillende oplossingen in de cloud en het reviewen van code van collega’s. Daarnaast kom je de volgende onderwerpen tegen in de projecten:Machine Learning en MLOps-toepassingen ontwikkelen in cloudomgevingen zoals Azure en AWSTechnologieën als Python, PySpark, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, Tensorflow en TerraformProcesvaardigheden zoals Scrum, DevOps, Automated Testing, CI/CDIn de projectteams met de klant gebruik je jouw soft skills als interview- en presentatietechniekenNaast inhoudelijk meewerken in de projectteams kun je ook junior collega's begeleiden of je specialiseren tot Technical Lead.Aanpak Future FactsWat Future Facts uitzonderlijk maakt in de markt is dat wij niet alleen de modellen ontwikkelen, maar deze ook naar productie brengen en daadwerkelijk implementeren in de cloud-omgeving van de klant. We rusten niet tot alles écht werkt en je de impact ziet van de vaak maatschappelijk-relevante oplossingen, zoals betere doorstroming in de sociale huursector, accuratere levering van postpakketten, het herkennen van aanstootgevende graffiti of snellere reparatie van een internetverbinding.Voorbeelden projecten:Voor de grootste chocoladefabrikant ter wereld, Barry Callebaut, heeft het team van Future Facts een model ontwikkeld om de kans op kinderarbeid bij lokale cacaoboeren te voorspellen.Het project ‘Hollandse Luchten’, wat vrij vertaald ‘Dutch Skies’ betekent, maakt gebruik van experimentele technologie en onderzoekt de waarde van nieuwe sensortechnologie voor inwoners van Noord-Holland. Er is een IoT-platform in AWS opgezet waarin de luchtkwaliteit continu wordt gemeten, samen met meetgegevens van de inwoners van Noord-Holland.Wat bieden wijSalaris tussen de € 4.000,- en € 6.500,- o.b.v. 40 uurEen leasebudget en bonusregelingTelefoon en laptop van de zaakOnkostenvergoeding én internetvergoedingSabbatical opties en goede pensioenverzekering27 vakantiedagen en 2 prestatieverlofdagenAandacht voor een persoonlijk ontwikkelingsplan en veel mogelijkheden om kennis uit te bouwen via cursussen, trainingen en opleidingenFlexibel werken: regie over je eigen werktijden - naast thuis en bij de klant, bieden we je een goed bereikbare werkplek in Amsterdam met een prachtig uitzicht over het IJWekelijkse stoelmassage, een gym, dakterras en Danz Café waar je altijd even een praatje kunt maken met je collega’sWat breng jij meeHBO/WO werk- en denkniveauMinimaal 3 jaar ervaring met cloud- en dataomgevingenJe bent gespecialiseerd in datalakes en analytics services binnen Azure of AWSKennis van big data processing (bijvoorbeeld Spark/PySpark, Kafka, AWS EMR, Databricks etc.)Kennis van storage- en database technologieën (bijvoorbeeld HDFS, S3, ADLS, GFS, Redshift, Cassandra, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Neo4J, FlockDB)De brug kunnen slaan tussen data, organisatie en data scientistsJe hebt een passie voor techniek, data en vooruitgangVloeiend in ten minste een programmeertaal (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL) Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift

title: Data Engineering Intern
description: Who We AreWe are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that collaborates with business partners and clients to create and implement the capacities and capabilities required to improve future performance. We operate across a wide range of industries, and with our embedded partnership model we commit to driving sustainable growth for industry-leading organisations, elevating their potential with a long-term vision.At Metyis, we develop integrated solutions that enable growth by working within our business partners’ organisations with diverse and multidisciplinary teams. This collaborative environment allows Metyis to build strategies and execute them through an ecosystem that combines Big Data solutions, Digital Commerce solutions, Marketing & Design solutions, and Advisory services.Our teams are set up so that you have plenty of room to build bigger and bolder ideas by speaking your mind and being creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you could achieve with a multidisciplinary team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.What We Offer3 months of intensive training from our super skilled Data engineering team on topics like data warehousing, data pipelines, distributed computing using Pyspark, data modelling & data lake.Followed by 3 months of relevant working experience on a live business case.Interact with clients regularly to drive their business towards impactful change.Play a key role in the team by creating new business solutions via data-driven insights.Receive guidance by a dedicated mentor to make sure you make the most out of your time at Metyis.Experience being part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.What you will doAssisting in the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines to extract, transform and load data from various sources.Helping with data warehousing and data modelling activities.Participating in the creation of data-driven solutions to support business needs.Collaborating with data scientists, business analysts and software engineers to understand and implement data requirements.Implementing data quality and data governance processes.Participating in code reviews and providing constructive feedback.Staying up to date with the latest developments in data engineering technologies and best practices.What you’ll bringPursuing a degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.Strong programming skills in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala..Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to work well in a team environment.Good communication and interpersonal skills.Passion for Data: A strong interest in data and technology, and a desire to learn and grow as a data engineer.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: For this position we require:• Academic degree (MSc / Phd) in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related field (required)• Software development skills such as Git, bash scripting and release management and proven success in bringing analytics models to production (required)• A minimum of 5 years of experience in advanced analytics / modeling / artificial intelligence activities working with large data sets (required)• Highly skilled in working with Python, PySpark and Spark (required). Skilled in working withing Azure Databricks (preferred)• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (required)Our ideal candidate:• Is motivated to work on models that realize measurable impact (i.e. catch criminals), not necessarily to build the most complex advanced analytics models• Is structured, precise, communicative, and can work well with different people and roles• Thrives in a high-impact, dynamic and high-paced environment• Is pro-active, has a business focus and can-do mentality to make a difference in fighting financial crimeThe candidate will take responsibility for delivering the following results:• Build functionality into our data model (TDM) while continuing to combine all (30+) data sources required for Transaction Monitoring in a computationally efficient way. Our sources contain event data[e.g., transaction data and logging data from sources like CNA, AZS, PEX, RASS] and enrichment data (e.g., customer data and cash data from sources like Siebel, Omnikassa, Geldmaat, VCM)]• Ensure the TDM design enables the customer to comply with all regulatory, audit and other internal requirements (e.g., building a version on account level and a version on customer level)• Set-up the TDM to function as a solid building block that can function on its own, and can be leveraged by other (KYC/TM) projects as well• Make the computational performance of the TDM sufficient for daily batch scoring and for one-off runs on multiple years of data (using (Py) Spark)Assignment description:• The goal of this assignment is to add functionality to our data model (TDM), which enables comply with regulatory deadlines on Transaction Monitoring model changes, lookbacks andtuning & back-testing.• This functionality needs to be set up and computationally optimized, but once it is running it will be BAU to maintain it, and no external support will be required anymore.• Alignment throughout the assignment with technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g. product owners) are expected to keep track of progress and results.• The Model Developer will accept the proposed solution if it aligns with technical and functional demands.End date: 1 -1-2025Location:In consultation, regular visits to the office in Utrecht which the candidate can schedule.

title: Digital Data Analyst (Entry Level)
description: We are seeking a motivated and analytic individual to join our team as a Remote Digital Data Analyst. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting and analysing large data sets, making data-driven decisions, and presenting findings to management.Responsibilities Collect and analyse large data sets from various sources Interpret data and identify trends and patterns Create reports and visualisations to communicate findings Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights Continuously monitor data for accuracy and completeness Identify areas for improvement and make recommendationsRequirements Proficient in SQL, Excel, and data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI Strong analytic skills with the ability to interpret complex data Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Attention to detail and accuracyIf you are a self-starter who is passionate about data and enjoys problem-solving, we encourage you to apply. This is an entry-level position with room for growth within the company.To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter highlighting your qualifications and why you would be a great fit for this position. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Data Analyst Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clients. Your teamYou will work closely with Rihab is one of our Data Scientists at SkillLab. Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models.Aaron leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. Anna is a data scientist specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will support our monitoring and reporting processes like finalising their delivery method and expanding the indicators for monitoring and automating reporting pipelinesYou will work with our Solution Delivery team on impact trackingYou will assist our data scientists in user & project segmentation and experimentationYou will cooperate with the developers and the UX team to improve data visualisations and insights in the productRequirementsIs this you?You studied in a field with quantitative analytical skills such as data science, statistics, physics, computational social science, computer science, etcYou are comfortable using SQL to retrieve and manipulate dataYou are comfortable in Python for performing data analysisYou have knowledge of essential statistics and data visualisationsYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeKnowledge of statistical tests (for example, hypothesis tests, factor analysis)Experience using PowerBI and integrating with cloud data warehousesStrong knowledge of Python and visualisation tools like StreamlitComfortable using a cliCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting! Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Data Analyst
description: Sam Media is a team of passionate and fearless creatives, marketing experts, Data wizards, and developers focused on delivering great products and services to hundreds of millions of mobile consumers worldwide. We are one of the pioneers and a leader in the mobile micropayment sector.We are an online performance marketing company, we build and market our products including Mobile Apps, Streaming Video and Music Services, Online Learning Portals and Mobile Games. Millions of users engage with our promotional content and digital ads every single day.We are a diverse team of more than 34 nationalities based in Kuala Lumpur, Amsterdam, Dubai, and Hanoi. We value ambition, open communication and learning from each other.As a data analyst, you will have a central role contributing to many decisions that we make every day. You develop actionable, data-driven insight for optimization of our creative campaigns, discovering hidden opportunities, or digging into the root cause of a discrepancy. You make sound arguments, supported by data for taking or discarding an opportunity.We are looking for a motivational candidate who can support our multidisciplinary teams finding actionable insights from our data and also work on developing new tools that help our company improve business performance from our Amsterdam office.About YouYou have hands-on software development and analytical skills. Our ideal colleague should love getting their hands dirty with building solutions, doing research, analyzing data and programming. You will need knowledge in designing and shipping solutions and tools across the whole stack.What will you be doing?Supporting our cross-functional teams. This includes developing and maintaining dashboards, generating reports, preparing data visualizations, and using data to forecast or guide business activity. Our main tools for this are Redshift (SQL) and Quicksight.Find actionable insights on our data and communicate them to improve and optimize our business.Design, build/improve and maintain internal projects built in Python, such as our early alerting system or our IP targeting optimization project. Both projects are currently being used within the company for error monitoring and process optimization respectively. And if you feel brave enough you can help to deploy them with Docker and Airflow!What do we expect from you?You should have a passion for coding, optimizing for business value and enjoy solving problems and building correct, extensible and simple solutions that match our scale and load.You should be proficient with Python and SQL. Having 3+ years of relevant experience as an analyst and/or software developer.Several of our projects are being built using Django, would be a plus if you have previously worked using this framework as we are continuous developing these projects.We use AWS suite (Redshift as our main analytical database along a swarm of EC2 to keep our services alive), Docker, Git, Airflow so a basic understanding of these technologies would be a nice to have.You are able to work in a fast-paced and multicultural environment where the main working language is English so fluency in verbal and written English is a must.What do we offer?A Competitive salary in line with market conditions and your skills and experienceAlthough this position isn't remote, we offer flexible working schedules.Established in 2006, we are a market-proven, well-established, international company with an informal culture. We trust our team members to get the job done, how they do it is up to them.We invest in the personal development of each Sam Median by taking courses, attending conferences, and other learning opportunities;We have regular team(building) events, including lunches, monthly office birthday celebration, and a yearly company tripWe have a creative office in the heart of Amsterdam with tasty coffee, tea, fresh fruit, daily fresh lunch, and beers on Friday afternoons.We offer visa sponsorship and a comprehensive relocation package when applicable.

title: BI Specialist
description: Wat maakt het zo interessant om als Business Intelligence Specialist bij HSO te werken? Data & Analytics is een snelgroeiende serviceline binnen de internationale organisatie HSO; Microsoft Gold Partner en onderdeel van de Microsoft Inner Circle. Large enough to serve, small enough to care! Groei met ons mee en geef zo je eigen carrière vorm. Jij bent: Een samenwerker! Een goed resultaat bereik je niet alleen: in een hecht team werk jij samen met hoogopgeleide professionals die altijd voor elkaar klaar staan en elkaar graag intellectueel uitdagen. Werken met mensen geeft jou energie! Een verbinder! Je weet wat nodig is om de gebruikers van data optimaal te bedienen. Je inventariseert de eisen en wensen van onze klanten door de gebruikers actief te benaderen. Zo breng je businesseisen en de oplossing bij elkaar. Je bekleedt een spilfunctie en weet tegelijkertijd inhoudelijk waar je het over hebt. Een sterke gesprekspartner! Je bent communicatief vaardig op verschillende niveaus. Je hebt consultancy skills en bent sterk in het managen van de verwachtingen van eindgebruikers. Jij hebt begrip voor wat gebruikers wensen en speelt daar praktisch en pragmatisch op in. Een innovator! Jij blijft op de hoogte van de nieuwste Microsofttechnieken. In jouw vak zie je jezelf als ondernemer die graag buiten de gebruikelijke denkkaders denkt. Wat ga je doen?Je start met je klantopdracht; Je vertaalt (management) informatie en rapportagebehoefte van de afdelingen naar een te implementeren oplossing met PowerBI.Je maakt data vindbaar, begrijpelijk en toepasbaar in één loket. Je vertaalt de wensen van de business naar functionaliteit. Je toetst fits en gaps aan de integrale informatievoorziening van onze klanten.Je beoordeelt en implementeert verzoeken voor aanpassingen of verzoeken tot scopewijzigingen op de informatievoorziening.Met je collega's houd je je bezig met het visualiseren van data en je ontwikkelt managementinformatieoplossingen waarmee bedrijfsinformatie op een efficiënte en veilige manier ontsloten en gebruikt wordt.RequirementsJe hebt minimaal een HBO-diploma in de IT of Bedrijfskunde;Bewezen werkervaring als Data Analist; Dashboard Ontwikkelaar of Management Informatie DeskundigeAantoonbare kennis van SQL;Kennis van principes van de Database structuur, Data Modelling, Data Warehousing (extract, transform en loading);Ervaring met Azure Data & Analytics producten en services (SQL en NoSQL Databases en PowerBI);Bewezen analytische vaardigheden;Probleemoplossende en pragmatische houding;Ondernemend en innovatief denkvermogen;Ervaring met werken met data in een technische en commerciële omgeving;Beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal om goed te kunnen communiceren in onze internationale (klant) omgeving. BenefitsEen goede beloningWerken bij HSO is uitdagend, we willen je daar graag een goede beloning voor teruggeven. Naast goede primaire voordelen bieden:Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd;Jaarlijkse bonus op basis van bedrijfs-, team- en individuele prestaties;25 Betaalde vakantiedagen per jaar (met de mogelijkheid om tot 10 extra vakantiedagen per jaar te kopen);Mogelijkheid voor workation;Pensioen van Be Frank;Mobiliteitsvergoeding waarbij je of een auto kunt leasen of het bedrag toe kunt voegen aan je salaris. Daar bovenop krijg 100% betaald van de ov-kosten;EUR 65,- Netto vitaliteitsbudget - we vinden het belangrijk dat we gezond blijven en een veilige werkplek hebben, zowel op kantoor als remote;Telefoonabonnement & standaard telefoon of CYOD met bijbetaling of EUR 10,- netto per maand voor eigen telefoon;Je kunt deelnemen aan het leasefietsplan;En vooral een leven lang leren. Al vanaf dag één begin je aan je onboarding programma en vanaf dan heeft onze Academy een hele leerreis voor je. Je ontvangt ook een GoodHabitz accountVrijheid, flexibiliteit en funHSO heeft een ondernemerscultuur met veel ruimte voor initiatief. Zie je kansen? Wij geven je de mogelijkheid om ze te realiseren. Je hebt veel vrijheid en flexibiliteit om je werkdagen in te delen, maar vooral om je eigen carrière vorm te geven.Je werkt in een internationale omgeving en werkt met bekwame mensen met verschillende nationaliteiten die worden aangemoedigd om verder te denken. Werkweken van 40, 36 of 32 uur behoren tot de mogelijkheden omdat wij van mening zijn dat de manier van werken bij jouw levensstijl moet passen. HSO heeft professionals in dienst die plezier hebben in hun werk en klaar staan voor elkaar. We omarmen een cultuur van bedrijfsgerichte activiteiten zoals twee keer per jaar bedrijfsfeesten en wekelijkse zomerborrels op ons dakterras en er zijn allerlei sportinitiatieven.Enthousiast? Heb je vragen vooraf?Neem dan contact op met onze recruiter Joseph. Hij helpt je verder met al je vragen. Voldoe je niet aan één van de eisen. Dan gaan we nog steeds graag met je in gesprek (jyoussef@hso.com).

title: Analytics Intern
description: We are looking for an Analytics Intern to join our team at VonWood and help us bring the wood industry into the 21st century.We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Analytics Intern to join our team. The intern will collaborate with various business units to understand product and business data and the underlying processes. They will be responsible for improving and updating our low-code application in Retool, building new workflows, identifying meaningful insights from large data sources, and designing, developing, testing, and implementing appropriate data-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will be proactive, open-minded, and have a strong interest in data analysis and visualisation.What wood you do?As an Analytics Intern you willCollaborate with various business units to understand product and business data and the underlying processes;Identify meaningful insights from large data sources; interpret and communicate insights and findings from analyses and experiments to product, service, and business stakeholders;Scrape, analyse and dashboard external data;Design, develop, test, and implement appropriate data-driven solutions through data analysis and visualisation.Why wood you?We are a fast-growing startup in Amsterdam. Besides being part of a young, fresh, and energetic team of over a dozen colleagues (you’ll be in good company), we can offer you the following:An international, ambitious startup culture with a sustainable touch;An inspiring environment of brilliant, fun, and creative professionals;Continuous learning and growth opportunities beyond your field of expertise;An internship compensation of €450 gross per month;Making a difference, by making the world more sustainable;Possibility to work from home;Convenient location near the business heart of Amsterdam (‘Zuid-As’) and Olympic Stadium.We are looking for ambitious individuals who thrive in fast-paced environments. We are building complex software solutions with a modern tech stack.Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Information Management, Business Analytics and Management, Information Science, Data Science, Data Engineering, or related fields;Excellent communication skills in English (both verbal and written);Strong attention to detail and a structured way of working;Proactive, open-minded, and flexible personality;Proficient in SQL;Some programming experience in python or a similar language;Bias towards action - We learn by building things, not by talking about building things;

title: BI Analyst
description: Who We AreWe are on a mission to make mental wellbeing accessible to everyone. At OpenUp, we support companies, their employees and the families of employees with mental well-being. Via our OpenUp platform, employees and their families receive direct access to health checks, self-help programs, group sessions and webinars, mindfulness training and a large team of recognized psychologists. In our company we build high performance teams in which people develop themselves to their fullest potential. We enjoy raising the bar and making it to the next level.Open Up is part of the LinkedIn Top Startups 2022 and is rapidly growing. We are expanding our international teams and we search for like-minded talent. We are already helping over 1000+ (international) companies and their employees, e.g. Rituals, Deloitte, Decathlon, Miele, KPMG, Adyen and McDonalds. We are the Dutch market leader. But that's not enough to achieve our mission: We aim to become the number one mental health partner in the whole of Europe.Your jobAs a BI Analyst in the Business Intelligence team, you will be supporting all the different OpenUp teams (e.g. commercial, product, psychologists) with data-related topics. You will work closely with colleagues from these teams to find new data insights, define key metrics and create data structures that could provide them with even better insights. You will also create and present reporting environments and dashboards to show the results of your analyses. At the same time, you need to be able to understand the bigger picture, be creative and always think a step ahead to proactively help your stakeholders take the best data-driven decisions. In return, we will give you the flexibility and trust to choose how to best solve and implement data solutions.In summary, you will:Design metrics according to the different business needs together with your stakeholders;Maintain, build and improve SQL/DAX queries to prepare relevant and optimized datasets;Build dashboards and reports around business priorities and strategy;Manage the relationship with key stakeholders in order to gather and guide reporting and data needs;Collaborate with colleagues from cross-functional teams with different expertises. Such as: commercial, product, tech, psychologists, HR and finance;Proactively translate the insights from your analyses and reports to actionable points that help stakeholders make the correct decision to improve their business;Be responsible for the long-term quality and maintenance of the data solutions implemented. About you:Bachelor or master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or any related field of study. 3-5 years of relevant work experience. Curiosity and motivation for solving data challenges, understanding business stakeholder and customer needs, and exploring the complexity of data. Excellent communication skills. You can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiencesExcellent written and spoken EnglishExcellent stakeholder and relationship management skills. The ability to propose and build new data solutions, and at the same time guarantee the quality and stability of existing solutionsProficiency in SQL/DAX and working with relational databasesExperience with data visualization tools (e.g. Metabase, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)Plus: Programming experience (Python/Spark/Scala/R)What We OfferOpenUp is fast growing and you have the chance to become part of this challenging journey. Your high impact role in this early-stage scale-up offers a lot of great opportunities and chances to grow with us.You are working in a diverse and international environment from our offices in the heart of Amsterdam. you work in our international commercial team but also closely with our Psychologists, Tech and HR teams. We regularly have (virtual) team events which make our work dynamic and challenging! We like to have fun together with a lot of team building activities like our weekly 'borrels', after work sport classes, the yearly ski-trip and our Paddle tournament. Which makes our work fun, challenging and dynamic. Next to that:Opportunities for personal and professional development. Competitive salary and compensation package. Flexibility to work from the office or your home office. We provide you with the hardware you need to work comfortably. Daily healthy and vegetarian lunch. Free and unlimited access to our mindfulness courses and psychologists. Next stepsExcited about this role at OpenUp? We love to learn more about you. Send us your application through our website and we will be in touch with you soon.At OpenUp, everyone is welcome to apply - regardless of color, age, gender, nationality or any other label. We embrace what makes you unique and we believe that a diverse team is crucial to success. If you are ready to OpenUp, join us!Our OpenUp and iPractice ventures help people become and stay mentally and physically healthy. We continuously develop our practice and online platform for mental well-being. Users can start directly with various online programs and connect face to face with a psychologist. All programs are evidence-based, result-oriented and short and sweet. Sustainable results come from daily practice and users are supported by an accessible system and network of psychologists. We offer our services all over Europe, in various languages. We help hundreds of people every day and the number of users is growing fast.

title: Data Visualization Specialist
description: Als Data Visualization Specialist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van alle bruikbare visuele inzichten binnen jouw domein(en). Je adviseert en traint anderen in het optimaal gebruiken van onze data visualisatie tooling, zodat de visualisatie van onze data leidt tot nieuwe inzichten en acties die Coolblue elke dag een beetje beter maken.Wat doe je als Data Visualization Specialist bij Coolblue?Wil jij jouw team helpen met datagedreven besluiten nemen en is het maken van dashboards helemaal jouw ding? Lees dan gauw verder!Dit vind je leuk om te doen Jij bent dé data visualisatie expert. Jij begrijpt hoe data jouw stakeholders het beste kan helpen om meteen te zien wat hun resultaten zijn en wat zij moeten gaan doen vandaag.Je legt resultaten van je collega’s vast met goede visualisaties en bruikbare inzichten. Denk aan de efficiëntie van onze fietsbezorgers, procesverbeteringen, klanttevredenheid en nog veel meer!Trainen van en advies geven aan analisten en dashboard specialisten die zelf met de visualisatie van de data uit jouw domeinen aan de slag gaan.Je houdt ervan pragmatisch te zijn voor dashboards die snel opgeleverd moeten worden. Tegelijkertijd ben je nauwkeurig in het volgen van richtlijnen als het gaat om structurele rapportages.Mensen in beweging krijgen door projecten te initiëren om het niveau van data visualisatie binnen je domein te verhogen. Je vindt het leuk om veel verschillende mensen te ontmoeten en ze te helpen. Zo ken jij snel al jouw stakeholders, op de werkvloer en bij de kantoorborrels.Hier herken jij jezelf inJe bent behulpzaam, servicegericht en goed in complexe onderwerpen in begrijpelijke taal uitleggenBij het zien van een cirkeldiagram bedenk je meteen hoe dat visueel beter kanJe vindt het gaaf om te zien hoe data elke dag nieuwe inzichten kan opleverenJij werkt na elke pubquiz je eigen statistics uit om te zien of je elke keer een beetje beter wordtKennis van één of meerdere visualisatie tools zoals Tableau, Looker, Data Studio, Qlikview of Excel.Minimaal hbo-werk- en -denkniveau.Dit zoek jij verder in een baanGeld.Hybride werken. We werken zowel vanuit huis als op kantoor.Ongekend goede werksfeer. Met collega's waar je blij van wordt, epische feesten, pubquizzen en andere teamactiviteiten.Reiskostenvergoeding, pensioenregeling en een vergoeding voor als je thuiswerkt.Met meer dan 30 trainingen in onze eigen Studiefabriek word je elke dag een beetje beter.Een kantoor op een toplocatie. Vanaf Rotterdam Centraal is het 3 keer vallen voor je er bent. Oké, het is 2 minuten lopen.Met nieuwe initiatieven en ideeën maak je ons blij. Of je nu een week, maand of een jaar bij ons werkt.Uitdagend werk om helemaal in op te gaan. Je vergeet af en toe dat je aan het werk bent.Korting op alle spullen die we verkopen.

title: CRM Analyst
description: For one of our clients, a big player in the e-commerce and consumer electronics, we are looking for a CRM Analyst. You will collaborate closely with the CRM and campaign management teams, furnishing them with pertinent information for a comprehensive understanding of their influence on sales. While your primary focus will be on CRM insights, you will also be an integral member of the larger Insights team, where mutual contributions to projects and skill enhancement are valued.You will:Conduct in-depth analysis and reporting of CRM and campaign KPIs.Ensure timely reporting to the management team through various tools including PPT, Excel, and PowerBI.Deliver comprehensive and actionable insights derived from data.Understand the purpose of CRM and effectively connect it with other business domains like Web and Media.Champion data visualization and employ data-driven narratives to shape marketing strategies.Are you the one?Relevant experience within a related field and function.Expertise in data visualization tools like PowerBI, Data Studio, QlickSense, Looker or Tableau.Proficiency in SQL is mandatory.Business-oriented mindset with communication, presentation, project management, and organizational skills.Proficiency in OA software such as Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.Fluency in English.The offer:Very flexible hybrid working possibilities, 2 days from homeThis position is located in Amsterdam.Great benefits besides your salary package.Office that is well connected with public transportation.At Ariad, we believe that building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills is critical to our success and the success of our clients. We consider candidates based on hard and soft skills, experience and business needs. *Excited about this role, but your experience and skills don’t align perfectly? Apply anyway! You may be just the right fit for this or other roles.

title: Research Data Analyst
description: A fantastic opportunity has arisen with a Asset Management organisation within their R&D department.The role of analysts in this department is to learn and apply the company principles to investments and support the asset class specialists for the operation of the models.As an Analyst you will gain multiple opportunities to learn in depth end-to-end investment processes for multiple asset classes and grow into becoming a specialist over time.As a Research Data Analyst, Amsterdam, You WillPerform key tasks related to data management and analysis of financial indicators and operating the models for the assigned class.Carry out research run models for portfolios and securities trading and compute performance.Provide the data in clear format to be utilised by the business.The Successful Data Analyst Will HaveDegree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Economics of Mathematics (Master's are advantageous)Prior professional work experienceExperience with Python/ SQL/ Matlab/ R or other math based programming languagesWillingness to be on-site 5 days per week.As The Data Analyst, You Will ReceiveCompetitive Base salary up to €60,000BenefitsBonusMorgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

title: Junior Data Analist
description: Verzamelen, structureren en controleren van data. Altijd met het doel: hoe kunnen we daar nog meer impact mee maken? Verder helpen van onze organisatie, door nog slimmer, beter, sneller of gewoon anders data te benutten of te combineren; Ontwikkelen van datamodellen en bijdragen aan datavisualisatie. Hoe complex ook, jij maakt het inzichtelijk; Schrijven van rapportages waarin je de bevindingen uit je onderzoek opneemt; Onderzoeken en stroomlijnen van diverse processen; Geven van advies aan senior management. Een brutomaandsalaris van minimaal € 2.800 tot maximaal € 3.400; Een uitdagend tailor made leerpad; 1-op-1-begeleiding en career counseling door een fieldmanager; Toegang tot de Bright Academy en een online leeromgeving. 22,5 vakantiedagen op basis van 36 uur. Ten minste een hbo- of wo-opleiding, bijvoorbeeld Data Science, Quantitative Finance, Computer Science, Econometrie, Wiskunde of een vergelijkbare studie; Ervaring met data modellering, procesoptimalisatie, visualisatie tooling en het verkrijgen van praktische inzichten; Een sterk analytisch vermogen. Daarnaast ben je pragmatisch en creatief; Interesse in (complexe) datavraagstukken; Basiskennis van ten minste 1 programmeertaal, zoals Python, SQL of R.

title: Internship Data Analyst
company: Stoov® | We warm people, not the planet.
description: What We’re All AboutAt Stoov we want to warm people, not the planet. That’s why we flipped heat on its head and made it personal. Like, really cosy and snuggly and warm and wonderful. Now people can turn down the thermostat and take warmth with them wherever they go. That is our heritage, and we are very curious to see where we go from here, together.What You’ll Be DoingYou will join the Data & Tech department as an intern, where you get the opportunity to take a look behind the scenes of a fast-growing scale-up. You will learn from your colleagues and perform analysis on a broad range of topics. The Data & Tech team supports all teams within Stoov and therefore works with all kinds of different data, e.g. sales and marketing, but also reshipments and customer service. You’ll help to build dashboards, but also perform ad-hoc analysis based on the business needs at the moment.You enjoy a role as data analyst intern, in which you;Perform data analysis on a broad range of topicsVisualize the data to translate it into useful and actionable insightsLearn to recognize chances: where can data be used to help the organization further? How can we start this?Check the quality of our data and make it transparent for your colleaguesWE’D LOVE IT IF YOU’DBe as dedicated to the planet as we are;Are in your 3rd or 4th study year of Commercial Economics, Business Administration or other business-related courses studies;Are eager to learn, proactive, analytical and add a daily dose of fun to your work;Like to work in a team, but can also act independently if needed;Enjoy the agility of a scale up. Can deal with change: no day is the same at Stoov®;Enjoy learning different aspects of Data & Tech.THE PERKS OF AN INTERNSHIP AT STOOV Working together with a team of ambitious and fun colleaguesA lively, informal and warm working environment;Delicious coffee, healthy lunches and plenty of after work drinks and activities;Many learning and growth opportunities;Contributing to building a fast-growing international brand;An internship allowance of EUR500 per month.WELLBEING & SUSTAINABILITYWarming people not the planet, is something we take very seriously at Stoov. We do everything with sustainability in mind and are hard on our way to becoming B corp. When we’re not thinking about mother earth, we’re thinking about you. It’s really important to us that you feel safe, welcome and appreciated. We’re a brand built on positive energy.WE WANT TO BE THE PLACE TO DEIBWe welcome everyone with wide open arms. We create an environment where everyone feels safe and welcome. And free to share the best version of themselves. No matter how they identify, who they love or what culture they feel at home in. For us, different people bring different experiences, perspectives and backgrounds. And we need all of those to grow as a company, and as individuals.GET IN TOUCH!If you are what we’re looking for and like the prospects of working in a fun, free spirited company that puts people first and takes great care of them, then maybe, just maybe, this is your sign to give us a call.

title: Data Scientist
description: Deadline Date: Monday 5 December 2023Time On-Site: 100%Required Start Date: 3 January 2024End Contract Date: 31 December 2024Required Security Clearance: NATO SECRETDuties and Role:Under the direction of the Section Head, the incumbent will perform duties such as:Applies existing data science techniques to new problems and datasets using specialised programming techniques to meet needs of the Agency and its customers;Selects from existing data sources and prepares data to be used by data science models;Evaluates the outcomes and performance of data science models. Identifies and implements opportunities to train and improve models and the data they use;Publishes and reports on machine learning model outputs to meet customer needs and conforming to agreed standards;Supports review of data science and AI activities, processes, products or services;Support development and maintenance of data pipelines for structured and unstructured data;Support maintenance of the Agency's data lakes, implementing updates and working with system owners to ensure data is available for analysis;Contribute to machine learning initiative across the Business Area with suggestions for ML approaches and implementation, including the processing of training data and performance assessment of machine learning techniques on datasets;Contribute to new/modifications to data science toolsets and metrics;Remain up-to-date with new developments in data science and AI to bring innovative ideas into implementation;Deputize for higher grade staff, if required;Perform other duties as may be required.Travel: Business travel to NATO and national facilities as well as frequent travel between the NCIA offices;Professional Contacts:The incumbent is responsible for:Active engagement with colleagues across the Agency;Supporting engagement with stakeholders, including industry and academia.RequirementsSkill, Knowledge & Experience:The candidate must have a currently active NATO SECRET security clearanceA minimum requirement of a Bachelor's degree at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (such as Data Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Science or Engineering) with 3 years of post-related experience;Experience with state-of-the-art data science, analytics and data integration tools;Use of data science tools to support data analytics and data visualisation;Experience involving supporting data focused operations in a technical organisation. Such experience should encompass at least 2 skills listed: Experience of working within a Big Data ecosystem, with tools such as DataBricks, Spark etc; Planning, executing and maintaining data pipelines; Knowledge of Machine Learning, statistical and mathematical models and ability to effectively explain them to both technical and non-technical colleagues;Proven ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing.Desirable Experience and Education:A Master's degree or higher at a nationally recognised/certified University in a relevant discipline (Data Science, AI engineering);Experience in data presentation tools e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau; Kibana; Dash; Streamlit;Knowledge of DevOps best practices (git, Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery pipelines etc)Experience with Cloud ComputingLanguage Proficiency:A thorough knowledge of one of the two NATO languages, both written and spoken, is essential and some knowledge of the other is desirable.
